result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody John Vavra

records.addlTxt: 2:59 PM Defendant Cody John Vavra in court.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter dismissed and read in.

11:28 AM Defendant Cody John Vavra in court.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on May 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:00 AM Defendant Cody John Vavra in court.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant waived his right to an atty in this matter. Defendant wishes to proceed with the preliminary hearing. Officer Jeremy Larson sworn in on oath to testify. Officer Larson identifies the defendant. DA Nolen presents Exhibits 1; defendants signature bail bond, The Court received Ex 1. DA Nolen presents Exhibit 2; 20CF47 minutes 1/26 motion hearing, The Court received Ex 2. Officer Larson excused from the stand. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial.  Information filed.  Court advises defendant of charges & penalties.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Clerk mailed DE correct signature bond for 22CF21.
Sent copy for DE to keep with return envelope for DE to return signed copy

Violation: Bail Jumping
Issuing Agency: Monroe PD
